column1: asëa aranion is the Quenya name of Athelas.
column4: 100 While the only direct translation by J.R.R. Tolkien of asëa aranion which has been published is "asëa of the Kings"
column5: it has been suggested that the whole name could mean "Beneficial (leaf) of Kings".http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm Quettaparma Quenyallo at http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/ Ardalambion (accessed 14 May 2011)http://www.tuckborough.net/plants.html Plants & Trees (cf. Athelas) at http://www.tuckborough.net/index.htm The Thains Book (accessed 14 May 2011)

column1: The rejected form asea aranaite was used in a manuscript version of The Lord of the Rings.
